metadata.title: CVE-2020-7059 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
When using fgetss() function to read data with stripping tags, in PHPversions 7.2.x below 7.2.27, 7.3.x below 7.3.14 and 7.4.x below 7.4.2 it ispossible to supply data that will cause this function to read past theallocated buffer. This may lead to information disclosure or crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-7059` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10

php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10

php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10').
